sentences.text: 3 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q&A with Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our Board has a keen interest in executive  talent management as well as governance best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We rigorously evaluate both executive management as well  as the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I can assure you that this is a very active and  engaged Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board manage risk?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk management has continued to be an important topic  over the past year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the entire Board is engaged in  the challenge of risk management, the Audit Committee  serves as the Boards initial touchpoint for identifying and  managing risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With Bill Ways leadership in conjunction  with the Board, we continue to deepen our capabilities  in risk assessment via a committee of officers and senior  managers that meet regularly and identify and assess  risks that can affect our business, including their potential  impact, the velocity with which they can arise, and action  plans to mitigate such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior management reports  to the Audit Committee on developments relating to  risk at each quarterly meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of our biggest risks  is commodity prices, and we have made significant  progress over the past year regarding the assessment and  implementation of our hedging strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What were the Boards key priorities over the  past year?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Addressing SWNs balance sheet leverage was our  first priority as we entered 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We as well as our  shareholders recognized that we were in a low commodity  price environment, and that $2.75 billion in credit facilities  and just over $1.0 billion in publicly traded notes would  be coming due by 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board formed an ad hoc  committee of outside directors to support the development of new financial strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This committee met regularly  with the Companys management and external advisers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With input from this committee, the Company successfully  rearranged and extended the maturities of its principal  bank credit agreements to 2020, raised roughly  $1.25 billion in equity, and paid down over $1.0 billion  in bank and bond debt, leaving us on sound footing  for a more challenging commodity price environment  going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board monitor environmental, social and  sustainability matters?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This topic is top of mind for our Board and our  shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We begin every Board meeting with a  review of environmental and safety performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  Health, Safety, Environment and Corporate Responsibility  Committee meets quarterly to review these topics in more  detail, including legislative and regulatory developments  affecting our industry and the Companys programs  promoting safety, environmental stewardship and  responsibility as a corporate citizen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This committee also  makes recommendations to the Compensation Committee  on the metrics for environmental performance and safety  used in our annual incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our risk management  process also addresses the long-term sustainability of our  business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are excited to have met our goal, announced  in 2012, of being fresh water neutral by 2016: our Company  replenishes or offsets more water from fresh water sources  through conservation projects and innovation than we use  in our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I encourage you to read our Corporate  Responsibility report on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our entire Board has also worked diligently over the past  year to ensure our CEO leadership transition was as  smooth as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This transition came during a difficult  time for the Company as well as the industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bill Way,  our CEO, demonstrated his effectiveness as a leader  and is wholly focused on delivering long-term value to  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the Boards focus going forward?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Going forward our Board will continue to focus its  governance efforts on ensuring SWN delivers value to our  shareholders in what has become an increasingly dynamic  and competitive industry environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tell us about your role as Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As non-executive Chairman, I work closely with our CEO,  Bill Way, in setting the Boards agendas, provide feedback  to management from the Boards executive sessions, and  facilitate discussion and collaboration amongst directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the skill set on our Board is deep, we have begun  the process of expanding the breadth and diversity of our  Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We recently added Jon Marshall to the Board, a  former public company CEO with significant industry and  governance experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After this annual meeting, the  median director tenure will be 5 years, with all having held  CEO, CFO or other senior management positions with  energy companies or investors in the sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Catherine A. Kehr  Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to ensure that a strong balance of skills, experience, personal qualities and diversity are represented in  the boardroom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our focus is to ensure that our directors bring their particular background, insights and knowledge  together for the benefit of Southwestern Energy and our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thorough understanding of our business Our director nominees bring together extensive experience in areas relevant to our  business including energy, finance and strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7 of our 8 director nominees  have extensive experience in  the oil and gas sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Experience and proven track-record in positions of leadership Our director nominees have acquired significant experience in leadership that includes  being a public company CEO, CFO, COO or Board member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our director  nominees have experience  in leadership roles serving in  senior management positions  or on boards of public  companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Refreshed over time Our director nominees offer a balance of experience and fresh perspectives, with an  average tenure of less than 5 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 0-4 years: 3 5-9 years: 5 Independent oversight to serve the long-term interests of Southwestern Energy and  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Almost all of our directors are independent, and non-executive leadership directors  meet regularly without executive leadership present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 7 of our 8 director nominees  have been determined by our  Board to be independent,  under the standards set  forth in the SEC rules, the  Corporate Governance  Rules of the NYSE and  the Companys corporate  governance policies.

sentences.text: WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 8

sentences.text: Proxy Statement Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who We Are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Southwestern Energy, creating Value+ is our core mission, implemented through our culture of continuous  improvement, innovation and responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our approach to all things at Southwestern Energy is governed by  our Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Formula
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SWNs mission is to create Value+ by providing energy to our world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Formula represents the essence of our corporate philosophy and how we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Wisely investing the cash flow from the underlying Assets Will create Value+ The Right People doing the Right Things
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Formula is the essence of our corporate philosophy  and how we operate our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal is to  manage our business for long-term shareholder growth,  and a primary tool for achieving long-term growth is  disciplined capital allocation and investment practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Southwestern Energy, we exercise this discipline by  seeking to achieve $1.30 of present value cash flow,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discounted at 10%, for each dollar invested, which we  refer to as 1.3 PVI.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also seek ways to consistently  deliver more to our shareholders through innovation and  new ideas that will create value for every dollar we invest,  increasing the value of our assets by delivering better and  safer operations year over year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SWNs business strategy and corporate responsibility  efforts are rooted in our Formula and the values it  represents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate responsibility strategy focuses  on the health and safety of our workforce, environmental  stewardship, community engagement and the identification  of emerging strategic challenges and opportunities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our V+ Development Solutions division oversees much of  this corporate responsibility work.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It was formed to apply  innovative thinking to find and build solutions for achieving  balance among our economic, environmental and social  impacts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: V+ Development Solutions focuses in particular  on advancing the development of Americas abundant  supply of natural gas as an essential part of future energy  sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To learn more about sustainable development  at SWN, please see Corporate GovernanceCorporate  Responsibility section below in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our full Corporate Responsibility Report is available at  our website at www.swn.com under the section Our  Commitments and the link to Corporate Responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our communities, we cultivate ongoing dialogue with  local officials, community members, businesses, nonprofit  organizations, emergency responders and land/mineral  owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These dialogues help to address the needs of  communities and provide stakeholders with a better  understanding of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also proactively seek out  stakeholders at the regional and national levels to engage in  problem-solving dialogues and productive partnerships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 9 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY 9 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Statement Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Shareholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board and executive leadership team value feedback  provided by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the dozens  of meetings executive leadership and investor relations  personnel held with shareholders throughout the year,  we reached out to representatives from holders of  approximately 80% of our outstanding shares during 2016  specifically to discuss our compensation and corporate  governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the fall of 2016 we spoke directly  with representatives of approximately half of our top 25  shareholders, representing approximately 40% of our  outstanding shares, about the corporate governance and  compensation practices important to them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While those  shareholders had differing views on some of the topics  discussed, we received the following feedback:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A number of our shareholders asked about  our commitment to the environment, both in  the communities in which we operate and as a  participant in industry-wide efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, comments and feedback were shared  with the Audit Committee, the Compensation  Committee, the Nominating and Governance  Committee, the Health, Safety, Environmental  and Corporate Responsibility Committee, and full  Board, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following this dialogue with our shareholders, the  Compensation Committee directed the implementation  of changes to the executive compensation program and  related disclosures, which are discussed below in 2017  Executive Compensation Updates in the Compensation  Discussion and Analysis section in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial majority of our shareholders  indicated strong support of our compensation  and governance practices, and also took the  opportunity to share their views on how we might enhance these practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Executive Compensation Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to  reward our executives for producing sustainable results  consistent with our strategy; to attract and retain the  highest quality talent; and to align pay with the long-term  interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive pay is tied to
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: company performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on our performance, the  total pay mix for our Named Executive Officers (other than  Steven Mueller, who ceased to be our CEO in January  2016) for 2016 was as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 21.0% 66.3% 1.7% 11.2% Pay Mix By Component (1) CEO Pay Distribution Base Bonus LTI Other
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Other NEO Pay Distribution Base Bonus LTI Other 28.1% 50.4%  3.3% 18.2%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Represents base salaries in effect as of December 31, 2016, actual performance-based annual bonus awards for 2016, which were paid in     2017, and the grant date value of the 2016-2018 performance awards, restricted stock and options (granted in December 2015 and January     2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bonus consists of total annual bonus payments, which include objective and discretionary components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Other pay     consists of any changes in pension value and nonqualifed deferred compensation earnings and all other compensation, each as disclosed    in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 10 WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 10
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Statement Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash severance  in connection with a change in control is paid  only if an actual or constructive termination of  employment also occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mix of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation  program contains both cash and equity  components and is weighted heavily toward  long-term equity-based incentives, with a mix  of these incentives among performance-based  stock units, stock options and restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Risk Assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee analyzes risk in setting executive  compensation each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs must  hold equity of a value equivalent to multiples  of their base salaries (two times for senior  vice presidents, three times for executive vice  presidents and six times for our CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward Future Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual option,  restricted stock and performance unit awards  vest over periods of three, four and three years,  respectively, to reward sustained company  performance over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we restate our financial  statements, other than as a result of changes to  accounting rules or regulations, we may recover  incentive compensation that was paid or granted  in the three-year period prior to the restatement,  regardless of whether misconduct caused  the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group Comparison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the help of  independent compensation consultants, we  annually analyze executive compensation relative  to peer companies and published survey data  for peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do Not Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross Ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We eliminated the excise tax  gross-up feature in all severance agreements  entered into with NEOs first employed after  2009, who include our current CEO and general  counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging and Pledging Company Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  policies prohibit the pledging and hedging of our  stock by our executives and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Repricing of Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not  permit the repricing of stock options without  shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Automatic Base Salary Increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs  base salaries are reviewed annually and the  decisions are based on market data provided  by our independent compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No increases were made for 2016, other than  for Mr. Way and Mr. Bergeron in connection with  their promotions in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Every vote cast at the Annual Meeting plays a part in the future of Southwestern Energy.

sentences.text: Please review our proxy  statement and take the time to vote right away, using one of the methods explained below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who own shares of common stock as of March 29, 2017, the Record Date, may vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There  were 502,526,469 shares of common stock outstanding on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock entitles the holder to one vote on all matters submitted to a vote at the Annual Meeting and any adjournment or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Matters

sentences.text: You are being asked to vote on the following:

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan to attend the Annual Meeting in person, please vote immediately using one of the following  advanced voting methods.

sentences.text: In all cases, you will need to have your proxy card in hand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attending the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders as of the record date or holders of proxies for them  may attend the Annual Meeting but must have photo identification  and proof of stock ownership and, in the case of a proxy holder, the  proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record (your shares are held in your  name) or hold a proxy for such a shareholder, valid photo identification such as a drivers license or passport showing a name that matches  our records will suffice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner (your shares are  held through a broker, bank or nominee) or hold a proxy for such a  shareholder, you must provide valid photo identification and evidence  of current ownership of the shares, which you can obtain from your  broker, bank or nominee.

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders on  May 23, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Southwestern Energy Company, or the Company, will be held at Southwestern Energy Company Headquarters, 10000 Energy Drive, Spring, Texas 77389, on Tuesday, May 23, 2017, at 9:00 a.m.,  Central Daylight Time, for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) To elect eight directors to the Board to serve until the 2018 Annual Meeting or until their respective successors  are duly elected and qualified, and the Board intends to present for election John D. Gass, Catherine A. Kehr,  Greg D. Kerley, Jon A. Marshall, Elliott Pew, Terry W. Rathert, Alan H. Stevens and William J. Way;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) To approve an amendment to the Southwestern Energy Company 2013 Incentive Plan to increase the number of  shares authorized for issuance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) To ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, to serve as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (6) To conduct an advisory vote on a stockholder proposal regarding voting standards, if properly presented; and (7) To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting or any adjournment or adjournments thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has fixed the close of business on March 29, 2017, as the Record Date for the determination of  stockholders entitled to notice of and to vote at the meeting and any adjournment thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys 2016 Annual  Report, which is not part of the proxy soliciting material, is enclosed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are welcome to attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not attend, it is important that your shares be represented and voted  at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can vote your shares by completing and returning the enclosed proxy card or voting instruction  card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you can vote your shares by telephone or over the Internet as described in more detail in this proxy  statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke a proxy at any time prior to its exercise by giving written notice to that effect to the Secretary of the Company or by submitting a later-dated proxy or subsequent Internet or telephonic proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the  meeting, you may revoke any proxy you previously granted and vote in person.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1 Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this meeting, stockholders are being asked to elect eight directors to serve until the next Annual Meeting or until their respective successors are duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The shares of common stock represented by the enclosed  proxy will be voted as instructed by the stockholder for  the election of the nominees named in this section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If  no direction is made, the proxy will be voted FOR the  election of all of the nominees named below other than  in the case of broker non-votes, which will be treated as  described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, with no stockholders having  made nominations, the number of nominees equals the  number of directors to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws provide  that, in any uncontested election of directors (an election  in which the number of nominees does not exceed the  number of directors to be elected), any nominee who  receives a greater number of votes cast FOR his or her  election than votes cast AGAINST his or her election will  be elected to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chairman of the Board promptly following the certification  of the vote, which resignation shall be promptly considered  through a process overseen by the Nominating and  Governance Committee, excluding (other than in certain  limited circumstances set forth in our bylaws) any nominees  who did not receive a majority vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee  becomes unavailable for any reason or if a vacancy should  occur before the election, the shares of common stock  represented by the enclosed proxy may be voted for such  other person as the Board may recommend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company  does not expect that any nominee will be unavailable  for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, upon the recommendation of the Nominating  and Governance Committee, has proposed the eight  nominees set forth below for election as directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All  nominees for director are presently directors of the  Company and, with the exception of Mr. Marshall, who  joined the Board in February 2017, were elected by  over 94% of votes cast by stockholders at the 2016  Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not represented in person or by proxy at the Annual  Meeting, abstentions and broker non-votes will have no  effect on the election of directors, other than counting for  purposes of a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws also provide that any  nominee who does not receive a majority of votes cast  FOR his or her election in an uncontested election is  expected to tender his or her conditional resignation to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information concerning the nominees is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that the stockholders vote FOR the election of each of the nominees to the  Board as set forth in this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 17 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1 Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Selection Criteria for Nominees for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Board is expected to bring a  valuable and often different perspective to the governance  of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When these differing skill sets are  combined in an environment of interaction and respect,  they give a greater overall skill set to the Board and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provide a strong governance structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate  Governance Guidelines, which are available on our  website at www.swn.com under Corporate Governance,  set forth certain criteria that apply to the selection of  director candidates:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Selection Criteria
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should be an individual of the highest character and integrity and have the  ability to work well with others
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominees skill set should  complement the backgrounds and experience of  other Board members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should have an inquiring  mind, vision and good judgment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should have sufficient  time available to devote to the affairs of the  Company to carry out the responsibilities of a  director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should be free of any  conflict of interest that would violate any  applicable law or regulation or interfere with  the proper performance of the responsibilities  of a director   Each director nominee should possess
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should have the capacity  and desire to represent the balanced, best   interests of all stockholders and objectively   appraise management performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee should possess  substantial and significant business experience  in specific areas of expertise that would be  important to the Company in the performance   of the duties of a director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each directors continuation on the Board is reviewed  before that director is considered for re-election at the  expiration of his or her term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its annual  recommendation of a slate of nominees, the Nominating  and Governance Committee, in consultation with the  CEO, reviews and assesses the contributions of those  directors selected for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the conclusion  of this process, the Chairman of the Nominating and  Governance Committee reports the Nominating and  Governance Committees conclusions to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once a director reaches the age of 75, he or she may not  be considered for re-election to the Board of Directors,  with certain exceptions provided in our corporate  governance guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee evaluates  the qualifications of each director candidate against  the foregoing criteria in recommending to the Board  concerning that individuals election or re-election as  a director, including members of the Nominating and  Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance  Committee, with direct input and advice from our CEO,  is responsible for assessing the appropriate mix of skills  and characteristics required of Board members based on  the Boards perceived needs at a given point in time and  periodically reviews and updates the foregoing criteria  as deemed necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company is committed to  considering candidates for the Board regardless of gender,  ethnicity and national origin.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any search firm retained to  assist the Nominating and Governance Committee in  seeking candidates is instructed to seek diverse candidates from traditional and nontraditional candidate groups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 18
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 1 Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Board Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the first quarter of 2016, the Board oversaw Mr. Ways  successful transition to President and CEO, following  Steven Muellers resignation as CEO in January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that same period, the Board worked diligently  with the Companys leadership to respond wisely to the  continued low commodity price environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the  Boards oversight, the Companys executive leadership put  in place a series of priorities and commitments, including  investing within cash flow, focusing on strengthening the  balance sheet and managing risk through a strategic  hedging program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board held five regularly scheduled meetings  and three special meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As was the case in 2015, each  director attended 100% of the meetings of the Board and  the Committees of which he or she was a member as well  as the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also reestablished  an ad hoc Finance Committee to be readily available, as  necessary, to assist on matters related to our efforts to  reduce and rearrange our outstanding debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below each nominees biography, we have included  an assessment of the skills and qualifications that  nominee brings to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gass retired in 2012 as Vice President of Chevron  Corporation and President of Chevron Gas and Midstream.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this role, he was responsible for Chevrons global natural  gas marketing and trading activities, as well as Chevrons  pipeline, power and worldwide shipping operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gass began his career in 1974 in Chevrons Gulf  of Mexico business unit in New Orleans, and over the  next 38 years held positions of increasing responsibility,  including heading the companys exploration and  production operations in southern Africa and in Australia  and Papua New Guinea.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gass served as a director of  Sasol Chevron Holdings Ltd and GS Caltex.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gass has  been a director of Weatherford International, Ltd. since  June 2013 and serves on the Compensation and the  Health, Safety and Environment Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He became a director of Suncor Energy Inc. in February 2014, where he  serves on its Governance Committee and chairs its Human  Resources and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Kehr retired in 2006 as a Senior Vice President and  Director of Capital Research Company, a division of The  Capital Group Companies, one of the worlds largest  investment management organizations and manager of  the American Funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this role, Ms. Kehr was responsible  for investment analysis and a portfolio manager of global  energy equities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Ms. Kehr was an investment  analyst and portfolio manager with responsibility for global  energy high yield debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to her tenure with The Capital  Group Companies, she held various managerial positions  at Atlantic Richfield Company and Payden and Rygel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2002, the Reuters Survey ranked Ms. Kehr among  the top 10 individual U.S. fund managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Kehr has  been a director of California Resources Corporation since  February 2015 and serves on its Audit Committee and  chairs its Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Skills and Qualifications of Particular Relevance to  Southwestern Energy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Skills and Qualifications of Particular Relevance to  Southwestern Energy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Kehr has a keen understanding of financial analysis,  investments and capital markets honed through her  experience investing across the entire energy spectrum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also brings governance perspective from her service  as a director of another E&P company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Kehr brings  a valuable investor perspective and understanding of  shareholder value to our Board, and her skills complement  those of the other nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gass has extensive experience with leading exploration  and production and midstream operational units of a major  integrated energy company, including senior executive  experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also brings valuable governance experience gained from his service on two other public company  board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This industry, leadership and public  company board experience enhances the Boards skills in  strategic planning, executive compensation and oversight  of operations, including HSE matters.

sentences.text: Mr. Rathert was a co-founder of Newfield Exploration  Company, a publicly traded E&P company, where he  served in various positions, including as executive vice  president and chief financial officer and as secretary, from  1989 until his retirement in August 2014.

sentences.text: Mr. Pew retired as Chief Operating Officer of Common  Resources, LLC, a Houston-based exploration and  production company, in 2010.

sentences.text: Mr. Pew was a co-founder of  Common Resources, LLC and served as Chief Operating  Officer from 2007 until the company was sold in 2010.

sentences.text: Prior  to that, Mr. Pew was executive vice president of exploration  at Newfield Exploration Company, where he led Newfields  worldwide exploration program.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since January 2015, Mr. Rathert has served as a director of  Kaspar Companies Inc. and Kaspar Texas Traditions, each  a privately held company, and since November 2015, has  served as a director of Encino Energy LLC, a privately held  exploration and production company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since June 2014, Mr. Pew has served as chairman of  the board of directors of Enerplus Corporation, a publicly  traded North American energy producer, where he has  been an independent director since 2010.

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Southwestern Energy recognizes that strong corporate  governance plays an important part in achieving our  objective of enhancing the Companys long-term value for  our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive leadership, led by the CEO, is  responsible for running the Companys operations, under  the oversight of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted corporate governance principles,  which together with our Amended and Restated Certificate  of Incorporation, Amended and Restated Bylaws and  Board committee charters, serve as the framework of the  Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, the Board  revises its corporate governance policies in response to  changing regulatory requirements, evolving best practices,  and the perspective of our shareholders and other  stakeholders.

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Corporate Governance Guidelines require  that a majority of the members of the Board be independent  of the Companys executive leadership and its significant  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a director to be deemed independent,  the Board must affirmatively determine that the director has  no material relationship with the Company or its affiliates  (either directly or as a partner, stockholder or officer of  an organization that has a relationship with the Company  or its affiliates), or any person (including the director) that,  with its affiliates, is the beneficial owner of 5% or more of  the Companys outstanding voting stock or any member  of the executive leadership of the Company or his or  her affiliates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Material relationships include commercial,  banking, industrial, consulting, legal, accounting, charitable  and familial relationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For making this determination,  the Board has adopted a set of director independence  standards as required by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Boards  independence standards, a director will not be deemed  independent if he or she:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has an immediate family member who has  received during any twelve-month period within  the last three years more than $120,000 in direct  compensation from the Company and its affiliates  (collectively), excluding compensation for service  as a non-officer employee of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (A) is a partner or an employee of a present or  former independent registered public accounting  firm of the Company or any of its affiliates; (B) is  the immediate family member of a current partner  of any such firm, or a current employee of such  firm who personally works on the Companys  audit; or (C) within the past three years, has been  a partner or employee of any such firm or has any  immediate family member who has been a partner  of such firm or an employee of any such firm, and  personally worked on the Companys audit;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is, or has an immediate family member who is,  currently employed (or within the last three years  has been employed) as an officer of another  entity where any executive officer of the Company  or any of its affiliates serves (or served) on the  compensation committee of such entity; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is, or within the past three years has been,  employed by the Company or any of its affiliate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has an immediate family member who is, or within  the past three years has been, an officer of the  Company or any of its affiliates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is a current employee, or has an immediate family  member who is an officer, of any entity that has  made payments to, or received payments from,  the Company for property or services in an  amount which in any of the last three fiscal years  of such entity exceeds the greater of $1,000,000,  or 2% of the entitys consolidated gross revenues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: has received during any twelve-month period  within the last three years more than $120,000  in direct compensation from the Company and  its affiliates (collectively), excluding director and  committee fees and pension or other forms of  deferred compensation for prior service (provided  such compensation is not contingent in any way  on continued service);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contributions to tax-exempt entities are not considered to be  payments for purposes of the foregoing standards, but are  considered in determining whether a director has a material  relationship with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the contributions  made by the Company to tax exempt organizations for  which one of our independent directors serves as an officer  exceeded the greater of $1 million, or 2% of such tax exempt  organizations consolidated gross revenues in any single  fiscal year within the preceding three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is, together with members of his or her immediate  family, the beneficial owner of 5% or more of  the Companys outstanding voting stock, or is  employed or retained by or serves as an officer,  director or representative of, any person that,  together with its affiliates, is the beneficial owner of 5% or more of the Companys outstanding voting  stock, except in each case
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to the extent the  stock has been beneficially owned continuously for at least two years or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the beneficial ownership  first equals or exceeds 5% after he or she  becomes a director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has determined that all of the nominees for  director, other than our CEO, Mr. Way, are independent under  our applicable independence standards.

sentences.text: The Boards Role in Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One of the primary responsibilities of the Board is reviewing the Companys strategic plans and objectives, including  the principal risk exposures of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although  each committee of the Board is responsible for evaluating  certain risks and overseeing the management of such  risks, the entire Board is regularly informed through  committee reports about such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This enables the  Board and its committees to coordinate the risk oversight  role, particularly with respect to risk interrelationships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board engages in a review of the Companys strategic  plan and the principal current and future risk exposures  of the Company, and the corporate compliance officer  also discusses with the Board the focus and results of  the Companys legal compliance program conducted for  employees in all locations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Audit Committees oversight role in  evaluating how the Company manages our enterprise risk  issues, our Compensation Committee evaluates the design of all of our incentive plans to assess whether any portion  of our incentive compensation programs encourages  excessive risk taking by plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The evaluation  conducted by the Compensation Committee is discussed  on page 35 under Compensation Risk Assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee oversees  risks associated with the composition of the Board and  other types of risks within its areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Health, Safety, Environment and Corporate Responsibility  Committee reviews health, safety and environmental  risks associated with our operations, as well as political  and public policy matters that affect the Company and  related risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has delegated to the Audit Committee, which  is comprised solely of independent directors, oversight  responsibility relating to how the Company manages  our enterprise risk issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this connection, the Audit  Committee discusses with executive leadership, the  internal auditor (or internal audit service provider) and  the independent auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the Companys major risk  exposures (whether financial, operating or otherwise),
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the steps executive leadership has taken to monitor  and control such exposures (including the Companys  risk assessment and risk management policies) and  manage legal compliance programs, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) such other  considerations as may be relevant to their respective  audits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management conducts quarterly enterprise risk  management reviews and updates the Audit Committee  at least quarterly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, at least annually, the entire
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors was comprised of four independent directors through the  2016 Annual Meeting and three independent directors following Mr. Kuuskraas retirement at that time.

sentences.text: Set forth below is  the report of the Committee on its activities with respect to Southwestern Energys financial statements for the fiscal year  ended December 31, 2016 (the audited financial statements).

sentences.text: The Committee has reviewed and discussed the audited financials with executive leadership;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has discussed with PwC, Southwestern Energys independent public accounting firm, the  matters required to be discussed under applicable auditing standards;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has received the written disclosures and the letter from PwC pursuant to applicable requirements  of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board regarding PwCs communications with the Committee  concerning independence, and has discussed with PwC its independence from the Company; and

sentences.text: Based on the review and discussions referred to above and relying thereon, the Committee recommended to the  Board of Directors that the audited financial statements be included in Southwestern Energys Annual Report on  Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing with the SEC.

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a written policy that governs the  approval of transactions with related parties, including,  among others, officers, directors and their immediate  family members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The related party transaction policy  applies to any potential related party transaction other  than a transaction involving less than $5,000 or involving  compensation by the Company of a related party who  is a director or officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys related  party transaction policy, directors and officers are  required to bring any possible related party transaction  to the attention of the Companys General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board has determined that the Audit Committee is best  suited to review such transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the first regularly  scheduled Audit Committee meeting in each calendar  year, executive leadership recommends transactions to  be entered into by the Company for that calendar year  with related parties, including the proposed aggregate  value of such transactions, if applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After review,  the Audit Committee approves or disapproves such  transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At each subsequently scheduled meeting,  executive leadership updates the Audit Committee as  to any material change to those proposed transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event executive leadership recommends any  additional transactions subsequent to the first calendar  year meeting, such transactions may be presented to the  Audit Committee for approval or preliminarily entered into  by executive leadership subject to ratification by the Audit  Committee; and if the transaction is not so ratified, the  transaction must be cancelled.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that our compensation policies and  practices appropriately balance near-term performance  improvement with sustainable long-term value creation,  consistent with our corporate philosophy, and that they  do not encourage unnecessary or excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the Audit Committees oversight role in  evaluating enterprise risk issues, the Compensation  Committee evaluates the design of all our compensation  policies and practices, including our incentive plans, to  assess whether they create appropriate incentives for  employees to perform and to remain at the Company  and to take appropriate risks and to discourage taking  inappropriate risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation for our employees  generally is structured similarly to our executive  compensation program: a base salary, performance- based annual bonus, and, for certain senior employees,  equity incentive compensation in the form of stock options,  restricted stock and/or performance units payable in  common stock or cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The less senior the employee, the  more that pay is weighted toward annual compensation,  with non-salaried, hourly employees receiving solely wages  and a comparatively smaller bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-based  annual bonus and long-term incentives have features  paralleling those for our named executive officers and  thus are designed to encourage intelligent risk-taking and  risk mitigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretionary portions reflect individual  performance with business unit performance reflecting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a significant share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Especially in operating positions, an  employees performance-based compensation is tied  not only to operating metrics but also health, safety and  environmental factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee  oversees all long-term incentive awards and reviews  them to assure they do not promote excess risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our balanced use of short- and long-term  incentives, mix of cash and equity incentives, metric  diversification and alignment to our business strategy,  capped payouts, and stock ownership guidelines, promote responsible decision making, attract and retain good  performers, and do not encourage unreasonable risk  taking related to the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a producer of natural gas, oil and related hydrocarbons, we acknowledge that there is a certain level of risk involved in all aspects of our activities, but our compensation  is structured to encourage levels of risk taken by our  employees that are appropriate and socially responsible,  reflecting our commitment to conducting our operations  in a safe, resource-efficient manner, protecting the  environment and being a good corporate citizen of  the communities in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the  Compensation Committees review and assessment,  the Company believes that our compensation policies  and practices are not reasonably likely to have a material  adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Southwestern Energy Company is committed to providing  the energy that powers our world, today and into the  future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Creating Value+ is SWNs core goal, with a clear  focus on continuous improvement, innovation, integrity and  responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to create value for our shareholders  while providing a safe and healthy workplace for our  people, acting as good environmental stewards and  being respected members of the communities in which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussed below are certain highlights of our  commitments relating to clean air and water.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2015- 2016 corporate responsibility report, which can be located  by visiting Our Commitments and the link to Corporate  Responsibility on our website at www.swn.com, provides  additional insight into our operations, goals, strategy  and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Air
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Methane, the primary component of natural gas, is a short- lived, high-global-warming potential greenhouse gas (GHG)  when emitted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Excessive methane leakage can partially offset  the benefits of natural gas as a lower-carbon fossil fuel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SWN  is a proponent of innovative, performance-based programs to  address methane emissions from the oil and gas sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mission of the ONE Future coalition, which was co-founded  by SWN and is helping to decrease emissions across the  natural gas value chain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company also tracks absolute GHG emissions and  emissions intensity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compared to 2014, our GHG emissions  intensity (i.e., per unit produced) in 2015 decreased 12  percent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our absolute GHG emissions in 2015 rose 21  percent for upstream operations, principally due to a  significant increase in production during that period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, our leak/loss rate was 0.184 percent of production.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2016, we committed to maintaining a leak/loss rate  below 0.36 percent of production.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This goal aligns with the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Water
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary goal of ECH2O has been to achieve freshwater  neutral by the end of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: That is, for every gallon of  fresh water we use, we aim to offset or replenish that gallon  through water-quality improvement projects or treatment  technologies that return fresh water to the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We  met this goal in our Fayetteville Shale play in 2015  a year  early  and we met it company-wide in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fresh, clean water is a precious natural resource that is  critical to natural ecosystems and human communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because water is also necessary for our operations, we  developed the Energy Conserving Water initiative, or  ECH2O, a holistic approach to water management with  four components: reduction, innovation, conservation  and protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains stock ownership guidelines for  directors and executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director must own  common stock with a market value equal to five times the  annual cash retainer that was in effect on December 6,  2013 (the date the stock ownership guidelines were last  amended) or the date the director joined the Board,  whichever date is later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ownership threshold must be  met within five years of December 6, 2013 or five years  of the date the director joined the Board, whichever date  is later.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until such time as the director reaches his or her  share ownership requirement, the director will be required  to hold 50% of the shares of common stock received upon lapse of the restrictions upon restricted stock and upon  exercise of stock options (net of any shares utilized to pay  for the exercise price of the option).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once achieved, the  required ownership threshold must be maintained as long  as the director retains his or her seat on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock that counts toward satisfaction of these guidelines  includes stock purchased on the open market, stock  obtained through stock option exercises, restricted stock,  and stock beneficially owned in a trust, by a spouse and/or minor children.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In instances where these stock ownership  guidelines would place a severe hardship on a director,  the Board will make the final decision as to developing an  alternative stock ownership guideline for a director that  reflects the intention of these guidelines and his or her  personal circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31, 2016, all  directors then in office held stock in excess of the levels  required in the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guidelines for the ownership requirements for executive  officers are discussed in the Compensation Discussion  and Analysis section beginning on page 54 of this proxy  statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires the Companys  directors and executive officers, and persons who own  more than ten percent of the Companys common stock,  to report their initial ownership of the common stock and  any subsequent changes in that ownership to the SEC and  the NYSE, and to furnish the Company with a copy of each  such report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To the Companys knowledge, based solely on review of  the copies of such reports furnished to the Company and  written representations that no other reports were required,  its directors, executive officers and more than ten percent  stockholders complied with all applicable Section 16(a)  filing requirements.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2 Non-Binding Advisory Vote to Approve  the Compensation of our Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to approve, on a non- binding and advisory basis, the compensation paid to our  named executive officers (NEOs) as described in the  Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) and the  Executive Compensation section of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that its executive compensation  program, which emphasizes equity awards and  performance-based cash incentives, is strongly aligned  with the interests of its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CD&A, beginning on page 43 of this proxy statement, describes the Companys executive compensation program  and the decisions made by the Compensation Committee in 2016 in more detail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Highlights of the program include  the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary constitutes no more than 20% of the target  compensation package of our NEOs (other than  Mr. Mueller) and the remainder is equity-based or is  otherwise contingent upon company and individual  performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: do not permit re-pricing of stock options without shareholder approval;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: do not permit pledging or hedging of Company  securities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs include features that we  believe mitigate risk without diminishing incentives,  including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: require recoupment of incentives in certain  circumstances to encourage responsible and  sustainable decision-making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maximum payout that limits annual incentive  bonuses or performance units;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program, including the changes  we have made for 2017 , results in part from ongoing dialogue  between representatives of our shareholders and members  of the Compensation Committee, which is described more  fully in the CD&A.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to approve,  on an advisory basis, the compensation of our NEOs as  described in this proxy statement by voting in favor of the  following resolution, which will be submitted for approval by  shareholders at the 2017 Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: mix of cash, equity and performance-based  incentives, balanced between annual and longer- term incentive opportunities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a significant stock ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity component of long-term incentive  compensation is designed to align executive  leaderships interests with those of our stockholders,  provides an incentive for achieving our long-term  performance objectives and constitutes the major  component of at-risk compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of  the NEOs is employed at-will and is expected to  demonstrate exceptional personal performance to  continue serving as a member of the executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the NEOs has an employment agreement or  a severance arrangement other than in the context of  a change in control.

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Southwestern Energy faced a low commodity price  environment in 2016, following a dramatic drop in  commodity prices in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and executive  leadership worked together to stabilize and bolster the  Companys short- and long-term financial health and  our capital program flexibility in light of changing price  expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following represent our principal  achievements in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Extended Debt Maturities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rearranged and  extended our bank credit facilities and successfully  tendered for approximately $700 million of near- term senior notes, which enhanced and stabilized  our liquidity and eliminated the overhang of near- term debt maturities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improved Margins.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generated cash flow from  operations of about $500 million, which reflects  the impact of an aggressive assault on costs and  improved drilling and completion performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committed to Capital Discipline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Invested within  our cash flow plus a portion of the proceeds from  our successful equity offering earmarked for this  purpose, with the remainder to debt reduction,  and in only those projects that met our rigorous  economic hurdles at strip pricing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managed Portfolio through Asset sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Intelligently managed our portfolio, including disposing of  acreage we were not planning to develop until  well into the next decade and using the over  $400 million of proceeds to reduce debt.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation paid to our named executive officers (NEOs) for 2016 reflects and rewards these and other  achievements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs for 2016 were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Title in 2016 William J. Way President & Chief Executive Officer R. Craig Owen Senior Vice President & Chief Financial Officer Mark K. Boling Executive Vice President & President  V+ Development Solutions John C. Ale Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary Jack E. Bergeron, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior Vice President  E&P Operations Steven L. Mueller Former Chairman of the Board & Former Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mueller resigned as our CEO effective January 6, 2016, but remained Chairman of the Board and a non-executive  employee through the May 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Way became CEO on January 6, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because Mr. Mueller served  as CEO for a portion of 2016, he is a NEO under applicable SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guiding Principles and Compensation Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to reward NEOs for producing sustainable financial results  consistent with our strategy to attract and retain the highest quality talent, and to align pay with the long-term interests  of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 43 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Formula
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Formula and our Guiding Compensation Principles
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our approach to executive compensation, like all things at Southwestern Energy, is governed by our Formula
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a more in depth discussion of our Formula and its role in our decision-making, see Proxy SummaryWho We Are  above in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alignment with Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We align the interests of the NEOs with those of our  investors by rewarding executive performance on the basis  of key financial measurements that we believe closely  correlate to long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A significant driver  of our NEO compensation is performance-based criteria,  including the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock ownership and holding requirements, which  require our senior executives to accumulate and  hold SWN stock equal in value to a multiple of their  base salary, and to hold a portion of shares they  subsequently receive until the requirement is met
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual cash bonus, the majority of which is  based on operational metrics that should drive  shareholder value over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: long-term incentives in the form of performance  units, the value of which is determined by stock  performance relative to peers and, in the case of past awards, key operational metrics over time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retention of Talent
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SWNs ability to maximize shareholder value depends on its ability to retain executives, and we seek to do so by  using incentives that result in longer and continued service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key elements of compensation that require continued  service include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: multi-year vesting terms on equity incentive  compensation, including restricted stock, stock  options and performance units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: supplemental and non-qualified retirement  program, which allows select executives to  continue to earn retirement benefits once  they reach the limits imposed by the Internal  Revenue Service
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Total Compensation Perspective
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program components are driven by the achievement of objective operation and financial performance criteria as well as SWN stock performance, all of which are used to encourage retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WWW.SWNANNUALMEETING.COM 44
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program incorporates many leading practices and is designed to reward our NEOs for the  achievement of strategic and operational goals and increases in shareholder returns, while discouraging unnecessary or  excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our executive compensation program supports these goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Double-Trigger Severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash severance  in connection with a change in control is paid  only if an actual or constructive termination of  employment also occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mix of Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation  program contains both cash and equity  components and is weighted heavily toward  long-term equity-based incentives, with a mix  of these incentives among performance-based  stock units, stock options and restricted stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Risk Assessments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee analyzes risk in setting executive  compensation each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs must  hold equity of a value equivalent to multiples  of their base salaries (two times for senior  vice presidents, three times for executive vice  presidents and six times for our CEO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reward Future Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual option,  restricted stock and performance unit awards  vest over periods of three, four and three years,  respectively, to reward sustained company  performance over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we restate our financial statements,  other than as a result of changes to accounting  rules or regulations, we may recover incentive  compensation that was paid or granted in the  three-year period prior to the restatement,  regardless of whether misconduct caused  the restatement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Peer Group Comparison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the help of  independent compensation consultants, we  annually analyze executive compensation relative to peer companies and published survey data for peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do Not Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Tax Gross Ups.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We eliminated the excise tax  gross-up feature in all severance agreements  entered into with NEOs first employed after 2009,  who include our current CEO and general counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Hedging and Pledging Company Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  policies prohibit the pledging and hedging of our  stock by our executives and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Repricing of Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not  permit the repricing of stock options without  shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Automatic Base Salary Increases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs  base salaries are reviewed annually and the  decisions are based on market data provided  by our independent compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No increases were made for 2016, other than for  Mr. Way and Mr. Bergeron in connection with their  promotions in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
