sentences.text: How We Make Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretion and Judgment of the Compensation Commit The Compensation Committee, consisting entirely  of independent directors, is responsible for SWNs  compensation and incentive plans and programs, reviews  all compensation for SWNs executive officers, and acts as  the administrator for SWNs equity compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, taking into account the recommendation of  the Compensation Committee, sets the compensation of  all senior executives, but with only independent directors  acting in the case of the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee conducts an  evaluation of SWNs compensation program to determine  if any changes would be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making these  determinations, the Compensation Committee consults  with its independent compensation consultant and  executive leadership, as discussed below; however, the  Compensation Committee uses its own judgment in  making final decisions regarding the compensation paid to  our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2013, the Compensation Committee has engaged  the services of Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC  (Meridian), an independent executive compensation  consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian is known for its expertise in  the E&P industry, specializing in board-level executive  pay consulting services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian reports directly to  the Committee, participates in Committee meetings,  reviews Committee materials, and provides advice to the  Committee upon request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, Meridian updates  the Committee on trends and issues in executive pay,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: comments on the competitiveness and reasonableness  of SWNs programs, and assists in the development and  review of SWNs annual bonus and long-term incentive  (LTI) programs, including commenting on performance  measures and related goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See our discussion of the  Compensation Committees assessment of Meridians  independence in our discussion of the Compensation  Committees responsibilities on page 30 of this  proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the CEO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Compensation Committees request, the CEO  provides an assessment of the individual performance and  appropriate compensation of the other executive officers  because of his direct knowledge of each executive officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO is not present  during voting or deliberations by the Committee or the  independent directors regarding his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of Peer Companies and Benchmarking
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews peer group  composition each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the assistance of Meridian, the Compensation Committee identified a group of companies  to reference as our peer group for compensation purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews the competitiveness of  our executive officers compensation and assesses the  overall competitiveness of our compensation programs  relative to the peer group, which is made up of companies  in the E&P industry with comparable types of operations,  revenue, market capitalization, assets and number of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we generally sought to provide total  direct compensation for our NEOs within a competitive  range of our compensation peers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These companies  are listed in the table below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individual compensation  packages may vary based on individual experience,  retention, performance in the role and market conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We removed Denbury Resources Inc. and Ultra Petroleum Corp. from the 2016 peer list because of challenges each  company faced to its business prospects.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have discussions with many of our shareholders on  an ongoing basis regarding various corporate governance  topics, including executive compensation.

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program consists of three main elements:

sentences.text: The performance units granted to our NEOs vest according  to the vesting schedules described above, depending  on SWNs total shareholder return relative to other  companies in our performance peer group described  below (Relative TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee  chose Relative TSR as a straightforward and objective  metric for SWNs shareholders to evaluate our performance  against the performance of our peers and to align with  shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measure Relative TSR for a three-year performance  period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An averaging period is used to determine the  beginning and ending stock values used to calculate  Relative TSR for the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mitigates the  impact on the long-term Relative TSR results of one-day or  short-term stock price fluctuations at the beginning or end  of the performance period.

sentences.text: Health, Welfare, Retirement and Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer competitive health, welfare and retirement  programs for our eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our health and  welfare programs include medical, pharmacy, dental, life  insurance and disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also offer a limited charitable  gift matching program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The life insurance and disability  programs provide higher benefit amounts for our NEOs due  to their higher base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives have disability  coverage that applies if they are unable to perform in their  occupation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, disability benefits for our officers  are capped at $16,000 per month for long-term disability  and 70% of base pay for short-term disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We offer retirement programs that are intended to  supplement our employees social security benefits and  personal savings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The programs include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Southwestern Energy Company 401(k) Savings  Plan, or the 401(k) Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a defined benefit plan, or the Pension Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a supplemental retirement plan, or the SERP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a non-qualified deferred compensation plan, or the  Non-Qualified Retirement Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan, which is available to all employees,  including our NEOs, allows a participant to elect to  contribute a percentage of his or her eligible compensation,  generally salary and wages, to an investment trust.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employee contributions are matched by us 100% for the  first 3% of the employees eligible compensation and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 50% for the next 3% and such matching contributions  immediately vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan provides a number of  different investment options, including our common stock,  for which a participant has sole discretion in determining  the allocation of their and our contributions among the  investment options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites, Allowances and Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The type and the value of perquisites for our NEOs are  reviewed and approved by the Compensation Committee  as part of its compensation decision-making.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the  primary perquisites for our NEOs are the payment of a  $7,380 annual car allowance, estate and financial planning  expenses for each NEO up to $18,500 per year, the annual premium for an executive medical plan that covers all  out-of-pocket expenses and an annual complete personal  physical exam.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse our NEOs for expenses  incurred with respect to estate and financial planning  because we believe the utilization of experts will reduce  the amount of time our executives will have to devote to  those matters while also maximizing the net value of the  compensation we provide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We permit our NEOs and members of executive leadership  to use our corporate aircraft for business-associated  personal use on limited occasions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This use typically  consists of permitting family members to accompany  the executive when traveling for business and is limited  to situations where the presence of the family member  will not conflict with the business purpose of the travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, we may permit personal use of the aircraft in very  limited situations where, absent such use, the executives  work obligations create a significant and inappropriate  imposition on personal plans or obligations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cost to us  of this benefit, if used by a NEO, is reflected in All Other  Compensation in the Summary Compensation Table.

sentences.text: Anti-Hedging and Anti-Pledging Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors and employees, including the NEOs, their  spouses and members of their households, are prohibited  from hedging the economic risk of ownership of our stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, the prohibitions relate to short selling and  buying or selling puts, calls or options and engaging in  transactions involving our securities when in possession  of material, non-public information or during certain  designated black-out periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors and officers with the title of vice president  or above, along with their spouses and members of their households, are prohibited from pledging shares of our  common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are aware of no existing pledging  arrangements by any of our officers or directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy for Recovery of Compensation (Clawback Policy)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company requires NEOs and senior vice presidents  or above to reimburse any incentive awards if it is  determined such awards were based on financial results  that became subject of a material restatement (other than  due to changes in accounting policy) or were payable due  to fraud, negligence, or intentional misconduct by such
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, bonuses, incentives or performance- based pay are subject to reimbursement, and the Board  may cancel restricted stock awards and outstanding stock  options and seek reimbursement of any gains realized on  the exercise of stock options attributable to such awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Code imposes a $1 million limit  on the amount that a public company may deduct from  compensation paid to the companys CEO or any other  named executive officer other than the Chief Financial  Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This limitation does not apply to compensation  that meets the performance-based requirement (including,  among other requirements, that the compensation be  paid only if the performance meets pre-established  objective goals based on performance criteria approved  by shareholders).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program  strongly emphasizes performance-based compensation,  thus minimizing the consequences of this limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Committee retains full discretion to award  compensation packages that will best attract, retain, and  reward executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, we have, and may  in the future continue to, award compensation that is not  fully deductible under Section 162(m) if the Committee  believes it will contribute to the achievement of our  business objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees, including NEOs, are generally eligible to  participate on the same basis in the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  purpose of the Pension Plan is to provide participants with  benefits when they separate from employment through  termination, retirement, death or disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code limits  both the amount of compensation that may be used for  purposes of calculating a participants benefit under our  Pension Plan and the maximum annual benefit payable to  a participant under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2016 plan  year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a participants compensation in excess of $265,000 is disregarded for purposes of determining average  compensation and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the maximum annual Pension  Plan benefit permitted under the Code was $210,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until December 31, 1997, our Pension Plan had benefits  payable based upon average final compensation and  years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 1998, we amended  our Pension Plan to become a cash balance plan on a  prospective basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A cash balance plan provides benefits  based upon a fixed percentage of an employees annual  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible officers and employees who were  participants in the Pension Plan as of January 1, 1998 are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: entitled to annual benefits payable upon retirement based  upon years of service through December 31, 1997 and  average compensation during the five years of highest pay  in the last ten years of service before termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the cash balance provisions of our Pension Plan,  each participant has, for recordkeeping purposes only,  a hypothetical account to which credits are allocated  annually based upon a percentage of the participants  base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The applicable percentage is equal to 6% plus  an additional percentage for participants in the Pension  Plan as of January 1, 1998.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The additional percentage  is based upon a participants age and is designed to  approximate any lost benefits due to the change to a cash  balance plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employee balances in the cash balance  account also earn a fixed rate of interest that is credited  annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The interest rate for a particular year is the annual  rate of interest of the 30-year U.S. Treasury securities for  November of the prior year with a minimum of 6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Interest  is credited as long as the participant maintains a balance in  the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 61 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Southwestern Energy Company Supplemental  Retirement Plan (the SERP) allows certain highly- compensated employees to continue to earn pension  benefits for retirement once they reach the limits imposed  by the Internal Revenue Service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives do not earn  or accrue above-market or preferential earnings on their  SERP accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SERP provides benefits equal to the  amount that would be payable under the Pension Plan  in the absence of certain limitations of the Code, less  the amount actually paid under the Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the  event of a change in control as discussed below under  Severance and Other Change in Control Benefits, the  benefits of a NEO under the SERP would be determined
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as if the participant had credit for three additional years of  service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The credit of three additional years of service is  designed to ensure that the pension benefits in the event of  a change in control are consistent with the other change- in-control arrangements between us and the NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are required to complete at least 1,000 hours  of service per year and are vested in the Pension Plan  and SERP after three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At retirement or termination  of employment, the present value accumulated benefit  credited to a participant is payable to the participant in the  form of a lump sum or in lifetime monthly payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Qualified Deferred Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEOs and other highly compensated employees are  also eligible to participate in the Non-Qualified Retirement  Plan, which allows any participant to defer income and  receive a match on the same basis as the 401(k) Plan,  subject to the same total cap as for all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In  addition, participants can defer all or a portion of their  annual incentive payments until termination of employment  under the Non-Qualified Retirement Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Salary amounts  that are deferred under the Non-Qualified Retirement Plan  are not included under the Pension Plan or the SERP but  a credit is given to the participant under the Non-Qualified  Retirement Plan to address the loss in pension benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Non-Qualified Retirement Plan is not funded and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: participants are our general creditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All amounts deferred in the Non-Qualified Retirement Plan increase or decrease  based on the investment results of the executives  requested investment alternatives and executives do not  earn or accrue above-market or preferential earnings on  their accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan distributions after employment ends  are paid out of our funds rather than from a dedicated  investment portfolio.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3 Non-Binding Advisory Vote on the  Frequency of Future Say-on-Pay Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in Proposal No. 2 above, the Companys  stockholders are being provided the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on the Companys executive compensation  program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on executive compensation  described in Proposal No. 2 above is referred to as a  Say-on-Pay vote and has been sought annually from our  stockholders beginning with our 2011 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation decisions in light of yearly feedback from  stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that current best  corporate practices and governance trends favor an annual  advisory Say-on-Pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the Board has determined to recommend  that future Say-on-Pay votes occur every year until the next  advisory vote on the frequency of future Say-on-Pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are not being asked to approve or disapprove  the Boards recommendation, but rather to indicate their  choice among the following frequency options: one year,  two years or three years, or abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by Section 14A of the Exchange Act of 1934,  as amended, we are required to seek our shareholders  vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay votes no less than  once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, the most recent vote on frequency, our stockholders voted to hold  annual Say-on-Pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding upon the  Board, the Company or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board values the opinions expressed by  stockholders and will take into account the outcome of the  vote when considering the frequency of future Say-on-Pay  votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the Board modifies its determination on the  frequency of future Say-on-Pay advisory votes, the next  vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay advisory votes will be  held at our 2023 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing stockholders with the following options  to select the frequency of our future Say-on-Pay votes:  every one year, every two years or every three years, or  abstaining.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Say-on-Pay votes  should be conducted every year to allow stockholders to  annually express their views on the Companys executive  compensation program and to provide the Board and the  Compensation Committee the opportunity to evaluate
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that the stockholders select ONE YEAR for the frequency of future Say-on-Pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board has selected PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, as the independent registered  public accounting firm of the Company for 2017.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its duties, the Audit Committee is required to  pre-approve audit and non-audit services performed by  the independent registered public accounting firm (the  independent auditors) to assure that the provision of  such services does not impair the auditors independence.

sentences.text: If a type  of service to be provided by the independent auditors has  not received pre-approval during this annual process, it will  require specific pre-approval by the Audit Committee.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee does not delegate to executive  leadership its responsibilities to pre-approve services  performed by the independent auditors.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 6 Focus on For and Against Votes  (Stockholder Proposal)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: John Chevedden, the holder of 90 shares of the Companys  common stock, has advised the Company that he intends to  present the following proposal at the 2017 Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Of greater concern, our companys voting policies   which discriminate against shareholders  create  misimpressions that endure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once figures are reported  in the press, they become indelibly imprinted on the  minds of shareholders and lodged in the public record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders request the Board to take the  steps necessary to amend our Companys governing  documents to provide that all non-binding matters  presented by shareholders shall be decided by a simple  majority of the votes cast FOR and AGAINST an item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  policy shall apply to all such matters unless shareholders  have approved higher thresholds, or applicable laws or  stock exchange regulations dictate otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Three facts:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CalPERS research found that 48% of the nations  largest corporations employ a simple-majority  standard  making it a mainstream practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this proposal, shareholders retain the  right to send a message by abstaining  in fact,  message-sending may be more effective if our  company cannot use abstentions to depress  reported outcomes on shareholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A simple-majority formula includes FOR and AGAINST  votes, but not abstentions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our companys current policies  disadvantage shareholders in three ways:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any suggestion that management-sponsored  and shareholder-sponsored items are treated  identically or equally is false, because  management-sponsored Director elections and  Say-on-Pay votes do not include abstentions in  their formulas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions are treated as votes AGAINST every  shareholder-sponsored item, but not when tallying  managements Director election or Say-on-Pay  votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advantages management while harming  shareholder interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why provide ballots on shareholder proposals that  offer three choices  FOR, AGAINST, and ABSTAIN   when in reality, stockholders only have two choices:  FOR or AGAINST?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notable entities favor simple-majority voting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: US Securities and Exchange Commission  (Staff Legal Bulletin No. 14): Only votes FOR  and AGAINST a proposal are included in the  calculation of the shareholder vote of that  proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions  are not included in  this calculation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absent conducting a survey, it seems presumptuous  to assume that every abstaining voter has read the  entire proxy and intends their vote to be treated as  AGAINST all shareholder items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS  the  nations leading proxy reporting service): a  simple majority of voting shares should be all  that is necessary to effect change regarding a  company and its governance provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. Counting abstentions depresses outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By simple math, including abstentions in a formula  lowers the vote result and raises the threshold require  to pass a resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This constitutes an unacknowledged supermajority  as  the percentage of abstentions rise, the supermajority  threshold increases at an exponential rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Support equitable voting and good governance at  Southwestern Energy Company:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Counting abstentions distorts communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Focus on For and Against Votes  Proposal 6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These practices cloud communication at stockholder  meetings  which is the only opportunity most  shareholders have each year to interact with each  other, management, and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 81 SOUTHWESTERN ENERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 6 Focus on For and Against Votes (Stockholder Proposal)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that the stockholders vote AGAINST the stockholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contrary to the assertions of the proposals  supporting statement, there is no general  SEC Standard for vote calculation, and the  ISS policy quoted does not specify how to  count votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our voting standards are clearly disclosed, are consistently applied, and we believe correctly reflect the intent of our  shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board does not believe that revising  our voting standards would be in the best interests of our  company or our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC does not mandate or prescribe any  preferred voting standard for determining how  the vote results should be calculated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC calculation rules cited by the proponent are  solely for determining whether a proponent  may resubmit a proposal at a subsequent  annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We clearly disclose all votes and our voting  standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company is fully transparent with the  results of voting on all issues, including  stockholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shortly after each  meeting, we file the exact votes (for, against,  abstain and broker non-votes) with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any interested stakeholder can view the actual results to determine whether more votes were  cast for than against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponent quotes ISS as recommending  that a simple majority of voting shares should  be all that is necessary to effect change  regarding a company and its governance  provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In context, voting shares means  shares entitled to vote, not those actually  voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless, our company has no  supermajority voting requirements, even on  such matters as approving amendments to  our governing documents, mergers and other  significant actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We disclose our voting standards in our proxy  statements (see page 83 in our Frequently  Asked Questions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a majority vote standard for all matters to  be voted by our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In uncontested director elections, we require  a majority of votes cast for and against abstentions do not count.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our management regularly engages with  representatives of our shareholders on  a variety of issues, not only economic  ones but also environmental, social and  governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We treat advisory votes on proposals  submitted by the Board or management,  such as say on pay, in the same fashion  as stockholder proposals; i.e., they too are  decided by a majority of the shares present at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We listen to our shareholders and often implement changes to our policies and  practices that they suggest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws reflect what the law of Delaware,  where the company is incorporated, specifies in the absence of a contrary provision: that  for a measure to pass it must receive the  votes of a majority of the shares owned by  stockholders who attend the meeting in  person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not see a need  to change what Delaware law mandates in  this instance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board carefully reviews any matter that receives significant support at a  shareholders meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who own shares of common stock as  of March 29, 2017, the Record Date, may vote at the  meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were 502,526,469 shares of common stock  outstanding on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of common stock  entitles the holder to one vote on all matters submitted  to a vote at the Annual Meeting and any adjournment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or postponement of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A complete list of  the stockholders entitled to vote will be available for  examination at the meeting and for at least 10 days prior  to the meeting at our corporate offices located at 10000  Energy Drive, Spring, Texas 77389.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How may I attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote your shares without attending by following  the instructions regarding proxies, which appear on  pages 85-86.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Admission to the Annual Meeting will be on  a first-come, first-served basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registration will begin at  8:00 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Central Daylight Time on the date of the Annual  Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting is limited to  stockholders, our employees, invited guests, and, in some  cases, special representatives of stockholders whose  proposals appear in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders  as of the record date may attend the Annual Meeting  but must present photo identification and proof of stock
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record (your shares  are held in your name), valid photo identification such  as a drivers license or passport showing a name that  matches our records will suffice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial  owner (your shares are held through a broker, bank or  nominee), you must provide valid photo identification and  current evidence of your ownership of shares, which you  can obtain from your broker, bank or nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The use of  cell phones, smartphones, recording and photographic  equipment and computers is not permitted in the meeting  room at the Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: This proxy statement and the accompanying proxy  are first being mailed, given or made available to  stockholders, on or about April 12, 2017.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may read, print and download our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Annual Report to Stockholders and our proxy  statement at www.swnannualmeeting.com and  www.proxyvotenow.com/swn.

sentences.text: Southwestern Energy Company has adopted a procedure  approved by the Securities and Exchange Commission  called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this procedure, the Company  may deliver a single copy of this proxy statement and the  Annual Report to multiple shareholders who share the  same address unless the Company has received contrary  instructions from one or more of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  procedure reduces the environmental impact of the  Companys annual meetings, and reduces the Companys  printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who participate in  householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon written or oral request, the Company will deliver  promptly a separate copy of this proxy statement and the  Annual Report to any shareholder at a shared address  to which the Company delivered a single copy of any of  these documents.

sentences.text: To receive free of charge a separate copy of this  proxy statement or the Annual Report, or separate  copies of any future notice, proxy statement or annual  report, shareholders may write or call the Company at the following:

sentences.text: What constitutes a quorum of stockholders?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We must have a quorum to conduct the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A  quorum is the presence at the Annual Meeting in person  or by proxy of stockholders entitled to cast a majority of  all the votes entitled to be cast as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because there were 502,526,469 shares of common  stock outstanding on March 29, 2017, the Record Date,  the quorum for the Annual Meeting requires the presence  at the meeting in person or by proxy of stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: entitled to vote at least 251,263,235 shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non- votes, abstentions and withhold-authority votes COUNT  for purposes of determining a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote  occurs when a broker holding shares for a beneficial owner  represents the shares at the meeting but does not vote on  a particular proposal because the broker does not have  discretionary voting power for that proposal and has not  received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I am the beneficial owner of shares that are held in street name by my broker, will  my broker vote for me?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How are broker non-votes treated?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the NYSE member rules, a member broker (that  is, a member of the NYSE) that holds shares in street  name for customers generally has the authority to vote  on certain routine or discretionary proposals if it has  transmitted proxy soliciting materials to the beneficial  owner but has not received instructions from that owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the NYSE precludes brokers from exercising  their voting discretion on certain proposals without  instructions from the beneficial owner, and the NYSE now
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expressly prohibits brokers holding in street name for  their beneficial holder clients from voting in an election of  directors and from voting on certain corporate governance  matters without receiving specific instructions from those  clients.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you hold your shares in the name of a  bank, broker or other holder of record, for your vote to be  counted on Proposals No. 1, 2, 3, 4 and 6 you will need to  communicate your voting decisions to your bank, broker or  other holder of record before May 19, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will you treat abstentions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions are counted for purposes of determining  whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purpose of  determining whether the stockholders have approved the  matters addressed by Proposals No. 1 and 3, abstentions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: will have no effect on the vote, but because Proposals  No. 2, 4, 5 and 6, require approval of a majority of  shares represented at the meeting, abstentions on these  proposals will have the same effect as a vote AGAINST.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?

sentences.text: On or about April 12, 2017, we mailed a notice  to stockholders containing instructions on how  to access our proxy materials and vote online at  www.proxyvotenow.com/swn.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because many of our  stockholders are unable or choose not to attend the  meeting in person and may have limited access to the  Internet, we also send proxy cards and offer electronic and  telephonic voting to all of our stockholders who hold their  shares in their own names (that is, whose shares are not  held by a broker in street name) to enable them to direct  the voting of their shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the record holder of your shares, you may vote  your shares
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) via the Internet,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) by telephone, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in  person at the Annual Meeting by proxy.

sentences.text: Confidential Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a confidential voting policy to protect  our stockholders voting privacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this policy, all  proxies, ballots and other voting materials or compilations  (collectively, Voting Records) that identify specific holders  of record or beneficially of any class of stock of the  Company, entitled to vote at any annual or special meeting  and the manner in which such holders voted shall be  kept permanently confidential and shall not be disclosed  to any entity or person, including the directors, officers,  employees or stockholders of the Company except
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to  allow the tabulator of the vote to tabulate and certify the  vote,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) to comply with federal or state law, including  the order of any court, department or agency having  jurisdiction over the Company, and to assert or defend  claims for or against the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) in connection with a  contested proxy solicitation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) in the event a stockholder  has made a written comment on a proxy card or ballot,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: or (v) if a stockholder expressly requests disclosure of his  or her vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy cards shall be returned in envelopes  addressed to the tabulator of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding  the foregoing, the tabulator of the vote may report to  the Company the aggregate number of shares voted  with respect to any matter and whether (but not how) a  stockholder has voted and shall report to the Company  any written comments on any Voting Records, including  the names and addresses of the stockholders making  the comments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any party receiving or tabulating the  Voting Records and any person serving as an inspector of  elections shall be given a copy of the policy and shall sign  a statement acknowledging receipt of the policy and the  obligation to comply with it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy does not operate  to impair free and voluntary communication between the  Company and its stockholders, including the disclosure by  stockholders of the nature of their votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THIS SECOND AMENDMENT (this Amendment) to the Southwestern Energy Company 2013 Incentive Plan, as  amended, is made and adopted by the Board of Directors (the Board) of Southwestern Energy Company (the  Company), effective as of May 23, 2017 (the Effective Date), subject to approval by the Companys stockholders.
